artist: Manufacturer: J. & E. Stevens Company, Cromwell, Connecticut, 1843–1950s; Designer: James H. Bowen
description: seated metal monkey holding a coconut in its lap; coin is put in monkey's paw, coconut top opens and coin drops into coconut; red base with green leaves and grass under monkey; lever on lower back opens mouth, paw and coconut; tail wraps around PL of monkey's leg; monkey's eyes close when mouth opens
inscription:
Inscription; Lender\'s Sticker

stamped into stopper, on bottom: [PATD; FEB 2 (illegible)]
markings: paper sticker, on bottom: [171G/ Monkey and Cocoanut/ 76625  3455/ 5500/ #163 M]
title: "Monkey and Cocoanut"
